alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Kearney; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 9:40PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Smith, Phillips, western Franklin, southern Phelps, western Kearney, southeastern Gosper, Furnas and Harlan Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 940 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Funk to near Atlanta to near Edison to near Wilsonville. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Funk, Atlanta and Ragan around 945 PM CDT. Wilcox around 950 PM CDT. Oxford and Hollinger around 955 PM CDT. Orleans and Hildreth around 1000 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Huntley, Alma, Stamford, Republican City and Harlan County Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Franklin; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Kearney; Phelps
